I first went to her for guidance when we were to try for a baby. She explained well, ** *********** ***** **** ***** Gave follic acid and within 3 months I was pregnant. No further visit was required.

¬†I had small csp in my anamoly scan. I was scared. She explained things so well and thankfully all was fine by the time of repeat scan. Initially I did not feel the doctor much friendly but later when I got covid, and was scared, in this situation as well she adviced some vitamins and said, be confident, and that words were so promising and she filled that strength to fight covid, being a friend.

Thanks again mam, for giving so much hope and strength and finally for giving us a beautiful baby girl. We have no words, and grateful tht we found such a good doctor.

A doctor with a healing touch, confidence imparting approach and soothing smile. I had visited her from the 6th month of my second pregnancy of recommendation of my neighbour nurse at the rainbow hospital. (I regret for not having known about her in my first pregnancy and earlier of second pregnancy).Being used to regular check ups with innumerable machines in gyneac hospitals, I was startled by her expertise to know the baby development without a machine. Just one scan towards end weeks and regular fetal heart rate check. Minimal medication and tests prescribed. Emphasis on diet and exercise only. During labour, with a touch she knew whether I had contractions and she was spot on. After a hectic day, she was still at the hospital until 4 am to welcome our angel to this world safe. I was amazed to see her concentration and care during the last few moments of my delivery. my post delivery recovery too was quick.hardly a week while I suffered for a month due to the stitches in my first pregnancy elsewhere. I do recommend her and request every visitor to place ur trust in her and can with confidence say she will stay by it.

Now about the few comments on wait time and related... Pregnancy is not a defined treatment unlike other diseases. Few moments can change all plans unexpectedly. You will realise the importance of being given preference when u r in pain or have uncertainty of the well being of self and the foetus. At such points, u wish others let u go and meet the doc first. After my delivery, she would have reached home only by 5am on a Sunday and she was back at the hospital by 10 am to visit me again. In 5hours, kindly think of how much sleep and rest she would have received, how much of her personal life she did  get. And please bear in mind, it's a routine for them and not a one of weekend that this happens. She too is a mother, wife, daughter and most importantly deserve a  "me time" to rejuvenate herself. Doctors who dedicate themselves like her for the well being deserve much support and appreciation from the society. If ppl donot want to spare a thought about them, plz don't hurt them..it's a social and moral responsibility to stand by them...

I sincerely pray for a long life for you so that many more healthy babies see this world safe. Thank you is just a confined word and hence not using itüòä
